p: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) is one of the major enteric pathogens currently threatening the swine population worldwide ( 1). Clinically, pigs infected with PEDV cause severe enteric diseases with a high mortality rate in suckling piglets, resulting in tremendous economic losses ( 2â€“ 6). The disease is mainly transmitted through feces ( 7), air ( 8), and contaminated feeds ( 9).
